field.label: Credential Source
field.helptext: The level of specificity at which Usernames and Passwords can be stored. "Per User..." allows each user to enter their own username/password for this Data Source via the "My Credentials" UI. If a Site-wide credential is defined, this will be used as the default if no per-user credential is provided.

entry.label: Per-user, with optional shared Site-wide Defaults

field.label: Name Identifier Formula
field.helptext: Formula to use to derive the Name Identifier from other fields on the User record, e.g. "{{$User.FirstName}}@skuid.com"

field.label: Salesforce My Domain URL
field.helptext: The API URL for your Salesforce org, e.g. "https://acme-widgets.my.salesforce.com

field.label: My Domain
field.helptext: To connect to Salesforce orgs with Skuid, these orgs must use My Domain. To configure your org for My Domain, go to /domainname/DomainName.apexp?setupid=OrgDomain

field.label: Database Host / IP Address
field.helptext: The host or IP address at which this database can be reached, e.g. "71.122.33.423" or "mydemoserver.mysql.database.azure.com".

field.label: Database Port
field.helptext: The port to which Skuid should connect to this database, e.g. 5432, 3306

field.label: Have all required fields for Test Connection
field.formula: ( ( !{{use_url_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{Host__ui}})) && NOT(ISBLANK({{Port__ui}})) ) || ( {{use_url_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_url_config}})) ) ) && ( {{Port__ui}} > 0 ) && ( {{Port__ui}} < 66536 ) && ( ( !{{use_name_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_name}})) ) || ( {{use_name_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_name_config}})) ) ) && ( ( !{{use_username_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_username}})) ) || ( {{use_username_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_username_config}})) ) ) && ( ( !{{use_password_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_password}})) ) || ( {{use_password_variable__ui}} && NOT(ISBLANK({{database_password_config}})) ) ) && skuid_stng__IS_VALID_HOST_OR_IP_ADDRESS({{Host__ui}})

skuid__messageBlock.description: Metadata caching is enabled for this data source

skuid__text.contents: Metadata explains the structure of your data to Skuid. It is possible to cache, or save, the metadata of this data source for future use instead of downloading it on each page load. Doing so can lead to noticeable performance improvements. Learn more

action.message: There was an error enabling the metadata cache: {{$PreviousAction.Error}}

tooltip.text: Skuid will store the metadata for that particular data source—greatly improving load times on any pages that use it

action.message: There was an error refreshing metadata: {{$PreviousAction.Error}}

tooltip.text: Re-download the metadata from this data source, grabbing the most recent updates in the process

action.message: There was an error disabling the cache.

tooltip.text: Clear Skuid’s cache of any stored metadata

skuid__text.contents: Configure your AWS Role with this Trust Relationship Policy

skuid__messageBlock.title: This name is already in use.

skuid__text.contents:
There are some things you'll need to do in your Salesforce org to help Skuid connect to it. While completing the steps below, you'll also need to return to this form and enter some values. Skuid needs this information to properly connect to your Salesforce org.

If at any point you would like more detailed instructions for these steps, see our Salesforce data source documentation.
Install Skuid in your Salesforce org

To use a Salesforce org as a data source, it must have the latest version of Skuid installed and licensed Skuid user credentials. For more information about installing Skuid in your Salesforce org, see Install and Upgrade Skuid on Salesforce.
Enable the Salesforce org's My Domain

My Domain must be enabled within your Salesforce org for Skuid to connect properly. For more information, see Salesforce documentation.

Once enabled, return here to enter your Salesforce org's My Domain value.
Configure a connected app in Salesforce

OAuth-enabled connected apps allow Skuid to communicate with your Salesforce org.

Select your preferred Salesforce UI, enter all required values, and then configure the app to match the settings below.

enableConditions.message: Please enter your My Domain in Step 2.
Please enter your My Domain in Step 2.

skuid__text.contents:
Within the API (Enable OAuth Settings) pane of the app, do the following:
  1. Check the Enable OAuth Settings box 
  2. Enter the following callback URL in the Callback URL field:
    {{$Site.CurrentSiteUrl}}/auth/oauth/callback
  3. Add the following to the Selected OAuth Scopes:
    • Access and manage your data (api)
    • Perform requests on your behalf at any time (refresh_token, offline_access)
After configuring these settings, save the app.

If you'd like to read more detailed docs for this step, see the connected app section of our Salesforce data source documentation.

After saving your connected app, a consumer key and consumer secret are generated. Skuid needs these credentials so your users can log in via OAuth.

Copy those values and enter them below:

enableConditions.message: No fields available to save as variables
No fields available to save as variables

skuid__text.contents: Saving these values as environment variables will allow you to reuse them across other data sources. For more information, see our documentation.

While Skuid will not provide SSL certificate information, it will accept encrypted data from servers that send SSL information in their responses. However, it will also retrieve data unencrypted if no certificate is returned.
After the initial SSL handshake, Skuid will encrypt queries and responses using the certificate information below. If the certificate information does not match, the queries will fail.

step.stepLabel: Step 3: How would you like to authenticate users to Salesforce?

skuid__text.contents: The level of specificity at which Usernames and Passwords can be stored. "Per User..." allows each user to enter their own username/password for this Data Source via the "My Credentials" UI. If a Site-wide credential is defined, this will be used as the default if no per-user credential is provided.

action.label: if an app id was passed in

skuid__text.contents:
Creating an OAuth-enabled connected app that can access and manage your org data via API will generate two credentials (Consumer key and Consumer secret) needed to connect Skuid to Salesforce.

If you need to create a connected app in Salesforce before creating this data source, you'll need the following Callback URL:  {{$Site.CurrentSiteUrl}}/auth/oauth/callback

skuid__text.contents:
Here you can save the values you've entered for these fields as environment variables. We've pre-filled their names, but you can change them to ensure they match variables you may have in other environments.

For more information, see our environment variables documentation.
